Post.title: D3
Post._content:
#### D3     

transform  Axis  , call     .
translate(x, top) : x  top  

#### D3   

```js
var svg = d3
  .select('#segment')
  .append('svg')
  .attr('width', 800)
  .attr('height', 200);

svg
  .append('line')
  .attr('x1', 10)
  .attr('y1', 10)
  .attr('x2', 700)
  .attr('y2', 100)
  .attr('stroke', 'red');
```

[] [d3-graph-gallery] https://www.d3-graph-gallery.com/graph/shape.html

Post.title: Git
Post._content:
####    Git 

Git     ,     ,          .

**Git First**

```html
// git clone ,  ..  ..
https://ID@github.com/ git clone XXX git init git add README.md git
commit -m 'first commit' git push origin master
```

**Git Branch**

```html
git checkout -b develop() git add . git commit -m 'xxx' git push origin
develop // hotfix git checkout master git checkout -b hotfix/YYYYMMDD
```

![post-2019-08-08-1](/img/post-2019-08-08-1.png){: width="100%" height="100%"}

gitignore      ,   stage     .
[hopeless][hopeless-blog]      cached   .

**Git Ignore**

```html
// .gitignore     // .idea/   git rm -r --cached .
git add . git commit -m 'ignore '
```

**Git Rebase**

```html
git rebase -i HEAD~2 // (   )    pick -> s //
pick  squash (s)   :wq
```

**Git Delete**

```html
git branch -d feature/dev-1 git push origin -d feature/dev-1
```

**Git Conflict**

```html
// 1. IDE     Webstorm : VCS > Git > Resolve Confilicts
Terminal: git merge --continue :qa // 2.    // HEAD ~ === 
 ,  commit . git add . git commit -m 'confilct
resolved'
```

![post-2019-08-08-2](/img/post-2019-08-08-2.png){: width="100%" height="100%"}

**Git Cherry Pick**

```html
git checkout release git cherry-pick #135bc
```

**Git Merge**

```html
git checkout A git merge B (Fast-forward :   .) git merge
--no-ff B ( merge  ) //    . git
status // git merge  <<<<<< HEAD #  checkout  A  
///// #  >>>>>> B #   B mereg conflic   add, commit
  merge commit .
```

**Git Merge **

```html
git merge --abort
```

**Git Reset**
  push    . (  ,    )

```html
git reset --hard HEAD^
```

**Git Revert**
     . WebStorm IDE  Revert   . ( - Git - Revert)

```html
git revert < >
```

**Git Permission denied (Window10)**

```html
//    ,     . git config
--global user.name git config --global user.email
```

**Git  **

```html
npm audit fix
```

[hopeless-blog]: https://brunch.co.kr/@hopeless/9

####    Git 

Git     ,     ,          .

**Git First**

```html
// git clone ,  ..  ..
https://ID@github.com/ git clone XXX git init git add README.md git
commit -m 'first commit' git push origin master
```

**Git Branch**

```html
git checkout -b develop() git add . git commit -m 'xxx' git push origin
develop // hotfix git checkout master git checkout -b hotfix/YYYYMMDD
```

![post-2019-08-08-1](/img/post-2019-08-08-1.png){: width="100%" height="100%"}

gitignore      ,   stage     .
[hopeless][hopeless-blog]      cached   .

**Git Ignore**

```html
// .gitignore     // .idea/   git rm -r --cached .
git add . git commit -m 'ignore '
```

**Git Rebase**

```html
git rebase -i HEAD~2 // (   )    pick -> s //
pick  squash (s)   :wq
```

**Git Delete**

```html
git branch -d feature/dev-1 git push origin -d feature/dev-1
```

**Git Conflict**

```html
// 1. IDE     Webstorm : VCS > Git > Resolve Confilicts
Terminal: git merge --continue :qa // 2.    // HEAD ~ === 
 ,  commit . git add . git commit -m 'confilct
resolved'
```

![post-2019-08-08-2](/img/post-2019-08-08-2.png){: width="100%" height="100%"}

**Git Cherry Pick**

```html
git checkout release git cherry-pick #135bc
```

**Git Merge**

```html
git checkout A git merge B (Fast-forward :   .) git merge
--no-ff B ( merge  ) //    . git
status // git merge  <<<<<< HEAD #  checkout  A  
///// #  >>>>>> B #   B mereg conflic   add, commit
  merge commit .
```

**Git Merge **

```html
git merge --abort
```

**Git Reset**
  push    . (  ,    )

```html
git reset --hard HEAD^
```

**Git Revert**
     . WebStorm IDE  Revert   . ( - Git - Revert)

```html
git revert < >
```

**Git Permission denied (Window10)**

```html
//    ,     . git config
--global user.name git config --global user.email
```

**Git  **

```html
npm audit fix
```

Post.title: Javascript Event
Post._content:
####     , `removeEventListener`  ?
     window  keyup       , 
       .   


####   this   ?
this    ,   call, apply, bind . 
 
[mygumi][mygumi] [zerocho][zerocho]   . 
call, apply    ,        .
call     ,   this  . 
apply  ,    . 
bind  this    .        . 
      .


``` js
function Person() { 
    this.name = this.name || "default"; this.authority = "guest";
    return this.name + " is " + this.authority; 
}

// call     .
Person.call({name: "bill"}); // "bill is guest"

// 1. bind  this .
const userInfo = Person.bind({name: "test"});  // undefined
// 2.  .
userInfo(); // "test is guest"

// call     .
const userInfo3 = Person.call({name: "test3"});  // undefined
userInfo3; // "test3 is guest"
```

####   ?
          . 
             .
 bind    , call         .   

```js
function funcA(value1, value2) {
  console.log(`value: ${value1} ${value2}`)
}

funcB = () => funcA.call(this, 2, 3) 
funcB() // value: 2 3
``` 

[mygumi]: https://mygumi.tistory.com/332
[zerocho]: https://www.zerocho.com/category/JavaScript/post/57433645a48729787807c3fd

``` js

// call     .
Person.call({name: "bill"}); // "bill is guest"

// 1. bind  this .
```

####   ?

```js
funcB = () => funcA.call(this, 2, 3)
``` 

--- layout: post title: 'Jekyll github ' date: 2019-08-07 categories: setting comments: false background: '/img/bg-index.jpg' --- #### Jekyll markdown(\*.md) . Ruby Ruby . RubyInstaller for Windows (Devkit ) . Ruby+Devkit 2.5.5-1 (x64) . [Ruby Installer](https://rubyinstaller.org/downloads/) --- #### [Jekyll ( )](https://jekyllrb-ko.github.io/docs/windows/) ```js // jekyll gem install jekyll bundler // jekyll new my-awesome-site cd my-awesome-site // jekyll (window) my-awesome-site $jekyll serve --watch // jekyll (mac) bundle exec jekyll serve --watch ``` ![post-2019-08-07-2](/img/post-2019-08-07-2.png){: width="100%" height="100%"} --- #### home . ```js _post / yyyy - mm - dd - title.md; ``` --- #### , 'jekyll-theme-clean-blog' . ```js // install gem "jekyll-theme-clean-blog" // _config.yml theme: jekyll-theme-clean-blog ``` .. .. . ![post-2019-08-07-1](/img/post-2019-08-07-1.png){: width="100%" height="100%"} --- #### Jekyll .. .. . [Clean Blog Jekyll][cleanblog] . , \_site . ```js // _sass / styles.scss; assets / vendor / startbootstrap - clean - blog; assets / main.css; ``` import . ```js // _sass/styles.scss /* Import Google Web Font */ @import url(http://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Nanum+Gothic:400,700); /* Style Blog Font */ h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6, p, blockquote, pre, ul, ol, dl, figure { margin-bottom: 15px; font-family: 'Nanum Gothic', sans-serif; } ``` --- #### Code Block .. . .. . Post.title: ES6
Post.raw:
---
layout: post
title: 'ES6 '
date: 2020-02-04
categories: javascript
comments: false
background: '/img/bg-post-11.jpg'
---

#### 1.import/export

     `export default `   .
      ,
          .

  Util     ,  .

`export default {}`  .  `import  from `  
`.`      .
           .

#### 2. spread

Spread   Object      .
     merge   ,
 Object     merge    .
       .

: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47103028/how-to-use-object-spread-with-nested-properties

```js
const source = { a: 2, b: 3, c: { d: 2, d2: 1 } };
const target = {
  c: { d: 4 },
};

const result = { ...source, ...target };
console.log(result); // {a:2, b:3, c: {d:4}}

const result2 = { ...source, ...target, c: { ...source.c, ...target.c } };
console.log(result2); // {a: 2, b: 3, c: {d: 4, d2: 1}}
```

1.import/export

. .

Post.title: Max, Min
Post._content:
### , 

ES6  Spread            .
Spread (...)     (-)   .

```js
const test = [190, 10, 16, 20, 60, 30, 40, 20, 60, 15, 50, 22, 8];

console.log(Math.max(...test)); // 190
console.log(Math.min(...test)); // 8
```

Post.title: NPM
Post._content:
#### NPM NPM v6 .
.. v.5.xxx . NPM . ```html // for window $ npm -version $ npm install -g npm ``` . ```js npm ERR! code EAUDITNOLOCK npm ERR! audit Neither npm-shrinkwrap.json nor package-lock.json found: Cannot audit a project without a lockfile npm ERR! audit Try creating one first with: npm i --package-lock-only ``` ```js $ npm audit === npm audit security report === found 0 vulnerabilities ``` #### NPM (Find the version of installed npm package) , . ```html $ npm view version ``` #### package json ```js // devDependencies $ npm install -D --save xxx // dependencies $ npm install --save xxx ``` #### ```js $ rm -rf node_modules/ ``` #### ```js $ npm insatll -D babel-core@^7.0.0-0 ```

Post.title: Javascript Object
Post._content:
object  string    `JSON.stringify()` .

```js
const obj = [{ name: 'first' }, { name: 'second' }, { name: 'third' }];

JSON.stringify(obj); // "[{"name":"first"},{"name":"second"},{"name":"third"}]
```

              .

```js
const obj = [
  { name: 'first', value: 1 },
  { name: 'second', value: 2 },
  { name: 'third', value: 3 },
  { name: 'third', value: 4 },
  { name: 'third', value: 5 },
];

const result = new Set(obj.map((v) => v.name));
console.log(result); // {"first", "second", "third"}
```

Chrome  Object     , console  
 Store as Global Variable   temp1   
`copy(temp1)`     .

[ (StackOverflow)][https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10305365/javascript-chrome-how-to-copy-an-object-from-the-webkit-inspector-as-code]

Post.title: Javascript Promise
Post._content:
####   Promise   ?

    ,            .
[pangyo][pangyo]    .
Promise   pending   then  , .
    .
  then()      (Thenable)    .

```js
getData().then((data) => {console.log(data)})

function getData() {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
    ...ajax call...loop...
    resolve(response)
    }
}
```

Post.title: SaaS
Post._content:
### 1. &  , $ 

-     `&`  .
-       

```html
.myAnchor { color: green; &:hover { text-decoration: underline; } }
```

### 2. Nesting

- nesting  .

```html
.test { font: { size: 30em; weight: bold; } }
```

### 3. Import

- sass  (partial)  (\_\_)   .
-       .

```html
// __vars.scss $width: 960px; // __header.scss #header { width: $width; } //
__vars.scss   // style.css @import "vars" @import "header"
```
